resources.string: No scanners found. Are you connected to a local network?
An error occured while trying to retrieve ScannerCapabilities:\n\n%1$s

The activity %1$s was called with missing extras.

The extras have the following values:
%2$s
The job was aborted because of an error
The job state can\'t be retrieved
No pages were scanned yet. Click the scan button :)
Copy current scanner options in eSCLKt format
Do you really want to close the scanning interface? Any scans that you didn\'t export will be lost!
Do not ask before deleting old scan files

When you close %1$s from the task drawer (not closing the scanning screen from within the app and confirming the exit dialog) %1$s has no opportunity to ask you how it should handle the temporary scan files (e.g. scanned pages and PDF exports). Therefore, they remain in the app files.\n\nThis option automatically cleans these files up on every app start. However, this means that these scan files (which you might not have exported) get irreversibly deleted on every app start without asking you again. When this option is not checked (default) %1$s asks every time to confirm that you want to delete the scans and exports from the app files.
A crash log was found. This is the exception which led to the crash. Please attach this to your bug report:

Temporary files (scans and/or exports) were found in the app storage. These are files which remain in the app storage if the app is closed from the overview or killed by Android while being in a scanning session. The main reason for this dialog is that asking for confirmation of deletion was impossible when the app was closed in this way.

What do you want to do with the following scan and export files?:
%1$s
